page.title: 08Prescott Hill Climb,Prescott
page.content: Prescott Hill Climb is run by the Bugatti Club and it holds several important races a year including some rounds of the British Hill Championship.Prescott meetings first started in 1938.There are six meetings a year.The objective is to get up the hill as fast as possible.The cars are divided into different classes.The long track record time is 38.81 seconds and the short track record time is 32.97 seconds.The long track is 1127 yds long and the short track is 880 yds long.Before a meeting the leaves have to be swept off the track and fire extinguishers are placed at intervals along it.During a run they put out a red flag if there's a car in the way.The officials include a chief paddock marshall,a start marshall and a doctor.200 cars can run in a day. Race day is usually on a Sunday.
